nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.statistics

Class Median

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.statistics.Median

  • public class Median
extends java.lang.Object
    This class calculates stuff about the Median of a population. The median is used in case a population is normally distributed, and it is likely that the distribution is skewed or has extreme outliers. In such cases, the median is a more robust and better estimator for the center of the population than the average is. The class calculates the median from a give list of Numbers or array of doubles. It is also able to produce a confidence interval. It may be used in a static way if you only want to retrieve the median. If you need the confidence interval too, then it must be used non-static.
    Author:
    Rinke

      • getMedian

        public static StatisticalNumber getMedian(double[] data,
                          double alpha)
        Gets the median of a range of numbers.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of doubles for which the median must be calculated
        alpha - an int indicating the level of the confidence interval. A level of 0.05 gives a 95% confidence interval
        Returns:
        a StatisticalNumber indicating the median, complete with confidence interval.

      • getMedian

        public static double getMedian(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> l)
        static method for retrieving the median

        Returns:

      • getMedian

        public static StatisticalNumber getMedian(java.util.List<java.lang.Number> l,
                          double alpha)
        static method returning the median as a statisticalNumber, including the confidence interval.
        Parameters:
        l - the data
        alpha - the level. A level of 0.05 brings a 95% confidence interval
        Returns:
        a statistical Number representing the number PLUS a confidence interval around it. In case of too little elements, a StatisticalNumber is returned with the isNull field set to true.

      • getHalfOfConfidenceInterval

        public java.lang.Double getHalfOfConfidenceInterval()
        This method gives the half value of the confidence interval width, so that it can be used in this form: 12 +/- 1.2, where the 1.2 would be the half of the confidence interval width. If the confidence interval is NOT symmetric (which can happen with medians), then null is returned. The method tests for this symmetry: if lower and upper half range differ more than 5% it is considered a-symmetrical.
        Returns:
        a Double indicating HALF of the confidence interval width. If the confidence interval is NOT symmetric, null is returned.

      • getLowerLimitConfidenceInterval

        public double getLowerLimitConfidenceInterval()
        calculates the lower limit of the confidence interval. The level alpha must be set via the constructor.
        Returns:
        the lower limit of the confidence interval.
